key_points: A local resident, first on the scene of Tiger Woods' accident, found him unconscious in his SUV.
The LA Sheriff's Department is seeking to review the vehicle's black box data to understand the pre-collision speed and brake usage.
There were no signs of impairment by substances; hence no tests were administered nor charges filed against Woods.
Speculations suggest Woods might have been distracted or asleep prior to the crash.
Woods suffered a shattered ankle, two leg fractures, and has had multiple surgeries.
The first responder, a mystery man living near the crash site, attempted to communicate with Woods but received no response.
Tiger Woods was described as 'calm and lucid' when fire officials extricated him from the wreckage.
Woods testified to deputies he had no recollection of driving or how the accident happened.
Woods thanked fellow golfers and fans for their support on his first public comment since the accident.
Rory McIlroy and other golfers wore red and black in solidarity, expressing their well-wishes for Woods' recovery.
